title: Projekt Triangle/Hyperkit/Dive Architects/More London - ???/(similar to) Pakt/DIN/Helvetica {-/Yves/Bert/Tim D}
content:
Font used in the navigation:  
 [http://www.projekttriangle.com/new/new\_2004.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/www.projekttriangle.com/new/new_2004.htm "http://www.projekttriangle.com/new/new\_2004.htm")

-----

Font used on logo and navigation:  
hyperkit.co.uk

----

Dive font used on background:  
 [http://www.divearchitects.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/www.divearchitects.com/ "http://www.divearchitects.com")

----  
The morelondon text:  
 [http://www.divearchitects.com/docs/home.php?id=3:0:0:0:0:12:1](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/www.divearchitects.com/docs/home.php?id=3:0:0:0:0:12:1 "http://www.divearchitects.com/docs/home.php?id=3:0:0:0:0:12:1")  
Better image here #31: [http://www.divearchitects.com/docs/home.php?id=1:0:0:0:0:0:0](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/www.divearchitects.com/docs/home.php?id=1:0:0:0:0:0:0 "http://www.divearchitects.com/docs/home.php?id=1:0:0:0:0:0:0")

Thanks in advance :)
author: NoDesign

comments.content:
morelondon looks like Neue Helvetica with a nick taken out of the d but it is tricky with those samples.  
Tim
Thanks alot. Any ideas on the hyperkit one?

The Hyperkit one looks like [YouWorkForThem](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/typophile.com/wiki/YouWorkForThem)'s [Pakt](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0016). Pakt is far better. I like [Garett Hague](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Garett%20Hague)'s [Cactus](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623012216/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=828&dw=2784) as well.
